title: How would MAKEATHON be conducted?
content: Keeping the current scenario in mind, MAKEATHON will be online this year. There would be no changes in the quality of participation and organization as such.

title: Can beginners participate in a MAKEATHON?
content: Yes. Participants for MAKEATHON are mostly first and second-year students. If a student is willing to learn and bring creative ideas to the table, then MAKEATHON is just the place for them!

title: Is coding necessary for a MAKEATHON?
content: No. It is a myth that coding is necessary for hackathons. MAKEATHON acts as a platform for similar minds to come together and execute new ideas.

title: What is the registration fee for the MAKEATHON?
content: Participation in MAKEATHON is free. There are no registration or participation fees.

title: Is a team required for participation?
content: Yes. A team shall have a minimum of 3 members to a maximum of 5 members.

title: How will the teams be judged?
content: The judging criteria involve concept, design, development, and presentation. A panel of judges would score the teams based on the criteria above, which would further determine the ranking of each team.

title: How can we choose our teammates?
content: There is no restriction on the formation of the team. Participants can make teams irrespective of their institutions.
